item.description:
I’m a third year PhD student at Cornell University in Computer Science currently supported by an NSF fellowship. My research primarily covers Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, and their intersection.

I’m advised by Serge Belongie and Claire Cardie. Before that, I graduated from the University of Washington majoring in Computer Science and Neurobiology. While there I worked with Ali Farhadi and Yejin Choi. I spent the time before that doing Computational Neuroscience research primarily in epilepsy modeling and detection as well as songbird learning.
